Table of Contents

Name

sbatch_nemo.sh - helper script to issue sbatch commands in SLURM

Synopsis

sbatch_nemo.sh options

Description

sbatch_nemo.sh is useful for certain sbatch operations on HPC systems, if you have an existing scripts runfile, that a simple

ascii file where each line has to run through sbatch

Options

-r run_file
If a text file exists with simple one liner shell commands, the -r flag can be used
-x script_file [args]
If a script has multi-line commands, plus knows how to pars command line arguments, the -x is appropriate.

Sbatch Directives

Each HPC system will have its own specific set of sbatch directives. 


#SBATCH -J $runid
#SBATCH -o slurm-%j-%x.out
#SBATCH -t 04:00
#SBATCH --nodes=1
#SBATCH --ntasks=1
#SBATCH --cpus-per-task=1
#SBATCH --mem=16G
#SBATCH --partition toltec-cpu
#SBATCH --parsable

Examples

For a given runfile that contains many one-line commands, the following examples are all equivalent, but expects the user to know if/when they can be used 
     bash runfile                       # serial, on any unix
     sbatch_nemo.sh runfile             # sbatch (slurm) on HPC
     parallel -j 4 < runfile            # gnu parallel on multi-core systems
     

See Alsoslurm(1), parallel(1), tricks(8NEMO)  AuthorPeter Teuben  Update
